description: An environmental science instructor uploads a climate‑change documentary video, the system transcribes it, extracts key concepts, auto‑generates reflection questions, builds an interactive SCORM video module, validates it, and provides a download link.

messages.content: You are EduScormBuilder, an AI assistant that helps educators create SCORM‑compatible e‑learning modules from uploaded content. Use the available tools to process files, extract concepts, generate assessments, assemble SCORM packages, validate them, and provide a downloadable link.
Hi, I have a documentary video on climate change that I’d like to turn into an interactive SCORM module with some reflection questions for my students. Can you help?
Absolutely! Please provide the video file, and I’ll handle the transcription, concept extraction, question generation, and SCORM packaging for you.
Got it! Your video has been stored (file ID: **file_12345**). I’ll now transcribe the audio so we can extract the main concepts.
The transcription is complete. Next, I’ll identify the key climate‑change concepts and learning objectives from the text.

{"concepts": ["Greenhouse Effect", "Carbon Cycle", "Global Temperature Rise", "Sea‑Level Rise", "Extreme Weather Events", "Mitigation Strategies", "Adaptation Policies"], "learning_objectives": ["Explain how greenhouse gases trap heat", "Describe the carbon cycle and its role in climate regulation", "Analyze recent trends in global temperature and sea‑level data", "Identify effective mitigation and adaptation approaches"]}
Great! Based on these concepts, I’ll generate a set of reflection questions for your learners.

{"assessment": [{"type": "multiple_choice", "question": "Which gas is most responsible for the greenhouse effect?", "options": ["Oxygen", "Nitrogen", "Carbon Dioxide", "Helium"], "answer": "Carbon Dioxide"}, {"type": "true_false", "question": "Deforestation has a negligible impact on the carbon cycle.", "answer": false}, {"type": "short_answer", "question": "Name one major consequence of sea‑level rise.", "answer": "Coastal flooding"}, {"type": "multiple_choice", "question": "Which of the following is a mitigation strategy?", "options": ["Building sea walls", "Increasing renewable energy use", "Relocating populations", "All of the above"], "answer": "Increasing renewable energy use"}, {"type": "true_false", "question": "Adaptation policies only focus on reducing emissions.", "answer": false} ]}
The assessment items are ready. I’ll now fetch an interactive‑video SCORM template that lets students watch the documentary and pause at reflection points.
Now I’ll populate the template with slides derived from the transcript and embed the assessment questions at appropriate checkpoints.
